from sklearn import metrics
print('Mean Absolute Error:', metrics.mean_absolute_error(y_test, y_pred))
print('Mean Squared Error:', metrics.mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred))
print('Root Mean Squared Error:', np.sqrt(metrics.mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred)))

source.b13a1f4e: we can see toefl , gre and cgpa are almost linearly dependent on each other. Someone with a high cgpa can be expected with certainity t have high gre and toefl score. However we cant include all of them. This will lead to extreme overfitting.
source.05974c1f: lets study the variables and the dependence of chance of admit on each individually.
source.2be5dcc1: First we try to find the correlation of each variable with each other.It can be noted that the chance of admission , our variable of interest has a significantly high value wrt to cgpa. Gre , TOEFL scores are important although not as important as cgpa. Research has a weak linear correlation.SOP AND LOR are also important.

source.7cc7b6ef: very high correlation between cgpa and GRE . we cant use both . otherwise it might lead to overfitting.
source.d7e73b98: Also. we can drop serial number . this is absolutely useless as seen from correlation data.
source.d800e531: As already proven above we can conclude that the most important factor for admission is cgpa with a corr of 0.87. GRE is important comin in second with a corr of .80.So we can say GRE is important with almost a linear dependency of admission on GRE but not the strongest.
